dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4610 IH: To conform Federal tax law with the Texas Constitution to allow for the continued benefit to the fullest extent possible from the financial leverage of the Permanent University Fund to the State of Texas.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Doggett (for himself and Mr. McCaul) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To conform Federal tax law with the Texas Constitution to allow for the continued benefit to the fullest extent possible from the financial leverage of the Permanent University Fund to the State of Texas.

section.header: Change of date relating to amount benefitting from special arbitrage rule

subsection.text: Paragraph (4) of section 648 of the Tax Reform Act of 1984 (Public Law 98â€“369, 98 Stat. 494) is amended by striking October 9, 1969 and inserting March 1, 1985.
The amendment made by this section shall take effect on the date of enactment of this Act.
